137348.release_notes:
## Version 2.0.0 (June 2025)

### Major Changes
- **Streamlined Data Syncing**
  - Simplified the core functionality to focus on direct Google Sheets integration
  - Improved data normalization for sheets with or without frozen headers
  - Enhanced error handling for invalid URLs and data formats

### UI Improvements
- **Tea Cup Animation**
  - Added animated steam effects with three particles
  - Implemented hover animations for the "Buy me tea" link
  - Refined positioning and styling of the tea cup SVG
  - Modified steam animation timing and positions

- **Instructions Modal**
  - Reorganized the "How to use" modal content for better clarity
  - Added clearer sections for:
    - Sheet preparation
    - Plugin usage
    - Layer syncing
  - Included tips about header rows and preview functionality

### Technical Improvements
- **Code Optimization**
  - Removed unused interfaces and functions for better maintainability
  - Streamlined the core data syncing logic
  - Improved error message handling
  - Enhanced logging for better debugging

### User Experience
- **Better Feedback**
  - Added clear success messages with layer count details
  - Improved error notifications with specific failure reasons
  - Added loading states during data fetch operations

### Documentation
- **Plugin Description**
  - Updated cover image text: "Instantly sync your Google Sheets data with Figma layers for seamless content updates"
  - Enhanced usage instructions and examples

plugins.name: Variant Randomizer
plugins.description:
Tired of manually clicking through component variants one by one just to create visual variety in your mockups? Variant Randomizer is here to help! This simple yet powerful Figma plugin lets you instantly randomize the variants applied to multiple selected components or instances that have more than one variant option.


How it Works:

Select multiple elements (components/instances) on your canvas.

Run the [Plugin Name] plugin.

Done! The plugin automatically assigns a random variant to each selected element that has multiple variants available. Elements with only one variant or no variants will be ignored.


Why use Variant Randomizer?

Save Valuable Time: Stop the tedious process of manually changing variants across many elements.

Create Realistic Mockups: Quickly add natural variation to lists, grids, user avatars, button states, icons, and more.

Boost Productivity: Perfect for working with design systems and large sets of components.

Simple & Fast: One-click operation after selection.

Works on Selection: Target only the elements you need to change.



You can help me mantain this plugin by Buying me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: nstantly randomize component variants across your selection.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

plugins.name: Figma 2 FRIDA
plugins.description: Users can select Figma frames to automatically generate clean, functional code for Flutter, React, Kotlin and Angular, with the code adapting to the specific data within the frames. This includes not only the UI components but also layout structures and other relevant data. Additionally, the tool provides the ability to generate automated test cases based on the generated code, helping ensure quality and functionality. For app deployment, users can generate the necessary icon files tailored for various platforms, simplifying the process for app deployment across different app stores and environments.

plugins.name: Refine Selection
plugins.description:
Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma


Transform your selection workflow with this powerful tool that helps you select and deselect layers with precision. Perfect for designers who work with complex designs and need quick access to specific layer types.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ One-Click Selection: Instantly select all layers of a specific type within your current selection

‚Ä¢ Alt+Click to Deselect: Hold Alt (or Option) to deselect layers instead of selecting them

‚Ä¢ Smart Layer Detection: Automatically identifies and filters:

- Text layers

- All shapes

- Primitives (stars, polygons, lines, rectangles, ellipses)

- Paths

- Lines

- Image layers

- Frame layers

- Components

- Instances


Workflow Benefits:

‚Ä¢ Save Time: No more manual selection of multiple layers

‚Ä¢ Reduce Errors: Precise selection of specific layer types

‚Ä¢ Smart UI: Buttons automatically disable when no matching layers are found

‚Ä¢ Intuitive Design: Clean interface with visual feedback


Perfect For:

Designers working with complex layouts

Teams managing large design systems

Anyone who needs to quickly select specific layer types

Designers who frequently work with nested components


üí° Pro Tip: Hold Alt (or Option) while clicking to deselect layers instead of selecting them!


Note: Free version includes rate limiting of 50 selection per minute. Subscribe to remove limitations and support future development.
plugins.tagline: Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma

plugins.name: Export Icon to Compose
plugins.description: Export Icon to Compose is a Figma plugin that lets you export selected vector objects as SVG and instantly convert them into clean, production-ready Jetpack Compose code for Android UIs. It automatically extracts the object's name, dimensions, and processes all <path> elements using the integrated svg-path-parser library. This streamlined workflow saves time, reduces manual coding errors, and improves your design-to-code process.

123503.description:
Generate Random Thai Names Plugin


Quickly generate random Thai names for your designs! This plugin allows you to select one or multiple text fields and generate random names for males or females, with the option to include or exclude surnames.


‚ùñ Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

‚ùñ Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

‚ùñ Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

‚ùñ Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!


---

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

plugins.name: TokenBoard
plugins.description:
TokenBoard is an advanced Figma plugin designed to give you full visibility and control over local variable collections ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre building a robust design system, managing light/dark modes, or maintaining consistent styles across teams.


Features Overview


Explore Variables by Collection, Scope & Mode

  1. Browse all local variable collections in your Figma file
  2. Organized as expandable tree structures by collection, group, and nested groups
  3. View and compare values across all modes (e.g. ‚ÄúLight‚Äù, ‚ÄúDark‚Äù)


Smart Search

  1. Instant full-text search across variable names, values, types, and scopes
  2. Highlights matches inside nested groups
  3. Keeps scroll position and selection while typing


Visual & Semantic Display

  1. Color tokens show live swatches, hex values, and opacity
  2. Boolean, number, string tokens are clearly labeled
  3. Aliases display as links to target variables with inline previews


Aliases & References

  1. Displays alias chains with resolved values
  2. Clickable interface to explore alias references
  3. Supports setting or detaching aliases via selector popup


Inline Editing of Values

  1. Edit most values directly inside the table: Colors (rgba), Strings, Numbers, Booleans, Aliases
  2. Shows validation states and editable highlights
  3. Supports editing multiple modes in a variable


Selection-Aware Variable Inspector

  1. Automatically detects all variables applied to the selected node(s) on the canvas
  2. Displays them grouped by collection, scope, and mode
  3. Resolves and highlights any aliases used
  4. Handles nested selections and multiple nodes
  5. Edit Values Directly from the Selection
  6. Selection-based variable data is cached with a unique key
  7. Improves performance when switching between nodes
  8. Cache is auto-expired after 5 minutes or can be manually refreshed


Batch Update

  1. Send a list of changes (e.g. 30+ variable updates) in one click
  2. Type conversion (color objects, strings, aliases)
  3. Font loading for FONT_FAMILY variables (with fallback to alternative styles if ‚ÄúRegular‚Äù not available)
  4. Scope checks and error recovery per variable
  5. Returns a report of successful and failed updates


Performance Optimizations

  1. In-memory caching of selection data with expiry (5 min)
  2. Caches up to 50 different selections to reduce API calls
  3. Tracks which variables are already loaded to avoid duplication


Figma API Compatibility Handling

  1. Graceful fallback if variable APIs or methods are unavailable
  2. Error messages guide user to fix or retry


Clean, Resizable UI

  1. Fully styled native-like UI with Figma theme support (light/dark)
  2. Flexible layout with resizable panel
  3. Displays progress during data load
  4. Empty states and error messages styled for clarity


Ideal Use Cases

  1. Design system audits
  2. Token cleanup and maintenance
  3. Visual QA of theme modes
  4. Alias linking and optimization
  5. Batch updates to variable values
  6. Color or typography token management


Compatibility

  1. Built for the latest Figma API with full variable support
  2. Works in Figma files only (not FigJam)
  3. Requires Variables feature enabled in your Figma workspace

plugins.name: Memoji Avatar Pack
plugins.description:
Add vibrant personality and diversity to your designs with the Memoji Avatars Library ‚Äî a massive collection of over 1500 high-quality memoji and avatar illustrations. This plugin lets designers easily find, filter, and insert expressive characters by gender, skin tone, expression, and name ‚Äî all without leaving your design workspace.


Whether you're creating user profiles, marketing materials, or social media graphics, these versatile memoji avatars help you craft inclusive and engaging visuals faster than ever. plugins.name: Brand compliance check
plugins.description:
Branding compliance check Figma Plugin


Purpose

The Branding-compliance-check plugin helps designers ensure that their design elements are consistent with the assets library added to their Figma file. It highlights and marks design elements that are not from the assets library, ensuring branding compliance.


Features

  1. Design Elements Check: Verify if colors, fonts, Non-component frames & effects are from the assets library.
  2. Highlight Issues: Select and bring non-compliant elements to the user's viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.


Usage guidelines

  1. Select Design Elements: Check the boxes for the design elements you want to verify.
  2. Highlight Issues: Click the "Highlight issues" button to select and bring non-compliant elements to the viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Click the "Mark issues" button to select and add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick sanity checks for Figma files to verify if design elements of file are brand library aligned

plugins.name: adamantium token lab - analyze, organize & export tokens
plugins.description:
adamantium token lab

Your ultimate Figma Variables exporter & manager to rule your tokens.


Stop manually transcribing design tokens! adamantium token lab bridges the gap between your Figma Variables and your codebase, streamlining your design-to-development workflow with unparalleled power and flexibility.


Whether you're working with a simple project or a complex multi-library design system, adamantium token lab gives you the tools to view, manage, analyze, and export your design tokens exactly how you need them. Say goodbye to errors, inconsistencies, and wasted time.


Why You Need adamantium token lab:

  1. Bridge the Design-Dev Gap: Seamlessly translate your Figma Variables into production-ready code.
  2. Ensure Consistency: Maintain a single source of truth for your design tokens across all projects.
  3. Boost Efficiency: Automate token exports, saving hours and reducing manual errors.
  4. Unmatched Customization: Tailor token output to perfectly match your team's coding standards.
  5. Maintain a Clean Design System: Understand token usage, identify unused variables, and keep your system tidy.
  6. Empower Collaboration: Provide developers with exactly what they need, in their preferred format.
  7. Handle Complexity with Ease: Advanced features like comprehensive library alias resolution simplify managing large-scale design systems.



Core Features:

Token Viewing & Management:

  1. View all Figma Variables (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) in a dynamic, resizable table.
  2. See token names, descriptions, types, and values per mode at a glance.
  3. Toggle in-table alias resolution to see actual values directly.
  4. Customize the display format for color values (HEX, RGBA, HSLA, etc.) in the table.
  5. Easily filter and view tokens from specific collections.


Powerful & Highly Customizable Export Engine:

  1. Export to CSS Custom Properties.
  2. Export to SASS Variables ($var).
  3. Export to SASS Maps (Nested or Flat options available).
  4. Export to JSON (Structured or Nested, with options for flat key paths).
  5. Export a developer-friendly Intermediate Representation (IR) for custom workflows.
  6. Apply naming conventions: camelCase, PascalCase, kebab-case, snake_case, and more.
  7. Add custom prefixes and suffixes to token names or filenames.
  8. Define custom path separators for token names (e.g., -, _, .).
  9. Output colors in various formats: HEX, HEX8, RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A).
  10. Configure numeric units (px, rem, em, pt) and base font size for rem/em.
  11. Choose your alias strategy: embed resolved values or reference original variables/map keys.
  12. Optionally include collection and mode names in exported variable names.
  13. Include token descriptions as comments in your exported code.
  14. Output JSON color values as strings or structured objects.
  15. Customize CSS mode selector templates (e.g., :root[data-theme="$MODE"]).
  16. See an instant live preview of your export with syntax highlighting.
  17. Download generated token files easily.


Advanced Token Usage Analysis:

  1. Identify which design tokens are actively used in your Figma designs.
  2. Analyze token usage on the "Current Page" or across the "Entire File".
  3. View a "Used" column in the token table for clear visual indicators.
  4. See updated collection counts showing (used / total) tokens after analysis.
  5. View a prominent banner confirming the scope and results of the last analysis.
  6. Filter the token list to show "All," "Used," or "Unused" tokens.


Deep Library Integration (All Features Currently Enabled):

  1. Effortlessly work with variables from your enabled Figma libraries.
  2. See clear indicators for the source library of your collections, including the library name where available.
  3. Includes powerful, deep alias resolution across external libraries ‚Äì essential for complex design systems, ensuring your exported values are always accurate.
  4. The UI intuitively displays information about library-linked aliases with distinct styling, providing full clarity in your token management.


Get Started with adamantium token lab Today!

Take control of your design tokens, accelerate your development process, and ensure unparalleled consistency across your projects. Install adamantium token lab and transform your Figma Variables workflow!



üå± This is a Beta Version!

adamantium token lab is currently in active development and is being released as a Beta version. This means that while we've worked hard to make it powerful and stable, you might encounter occasional bugs or quirks.


Your Feedback is Gold! ü™ô

We are incredibly passionate about making adamantium token lab the best token management tool for you, and your experience and insights are crucial to this journey. As you use the plugin, please help us improve by:


  1. Reporting any bugs or issues you encounter.
  2. Sharing your feature requests and ideas for new functionality.
  3. Letting us know what you love and what could be even better.


Your feedback will directly shape the future of adamantium token lab, helping us to squash bugs, refine features, and build the ultimate token workflow tool. We're committed to regular updates and improvements based on your input.
plugins.tagline: analyze, organize, name, export, cleanup. One token lab to rule your tokens (figma variables).
